cyclone.name: CHRIS
cyclone.current_location: about 230 miles SSE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to meander just off the North Carolina coast through the weekend, then turn northeast and accelerate away from the U.S. coast early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: None – system forecast to remain offshore

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Offshore waters and portions of the North Carolina coast, especially Cape Hatteras and adjacent barrier islands
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (peak 35–45 mph) possible late Saturday night through Sunday as the cyclone passes offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal water rise of 1–2 ft above normal tides possible, mainly along exposed beaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: Generally light to moderate showers; rainfall totals expected to remain under 2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf likely through the weekend.
